programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team sets off on a high-altitude trek from Kathmandu, capital of Nepal, to the Forbidden City of Lo Manthang, a secretive kingdom perched high on the Tibetan plateau, on the far side of the Himalayas. On a five-day expedition through the highest mountains, deepest gorges and harshest terrain on the planet, Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris battle huge river crossings, vast mudslides and dizzying mountain passes on a trip that would test even the hardiest new 4x4s to the limit. But Paddy, Freddie and Chris aren't crossing the Himalayas in new 4x4s. They're crossing the Himalayas in a small old Peugeot, a very compact old Renault, and Nepal's first (and only) home-built car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are challenged to build a bridge over the River Kwai in Thailand. In order to do that, however, they have to drive across Burma, a country that has been largely closed to Westerners for more than 40 years, and must make the trip in three lorries, each bought sight unseen from the internet on a limited budget. What follows is an epic journey of beautiful scenery, regular adversity, ongoing malfunction and the constant bickering of the three men.

Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A refugee from war-torn Venezuela tells officers how she paid human traffickers to smuggle her through Central America and to the Mexico-United States border. In Laredo, an American couple caught smuggling methamphetamine inside cans of vegetables crumble while being questioned and give officers information about a chain of so-called 'stash houses' where drugs and illegal immigrants are being kept.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall, winner of the 2017 World's Strongest Man contest, tours the USA on a quest to conquer the biggest and best eye-watering food and physical challenges. Eddie lands in Florida Keys to attempt a conch-fritter eating record, do some serious big-game fishing and try what's billed as the best Key Lime Pie on earth.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall squares up to the Mac & Cheese Challenge at Brooklyn's Mac Shack - which weighs in at more than two kilograms and nearly 7,000 calories of pasta, cheese and sauce.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to the countryside where they harness a group of hi-tech tractors and try to cultivate their own source of fuel. Meanwhile, the Lamborghini Murcielago LP640 is put through its paces, and actress Kristin Scott Thomas is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May build their own stretch limousines out of other vehicles and use them to transport celebrities to the Brit Awards. Meanwhile, a Ford Mustang is put through its paces, and actress Billie Piper is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites boxer Nicola Adams, comedian Frankie Boyle and comedy actress Diane Morgan to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include magicians, losing one's keys and life itself.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Grumpy comic Jack Dee, footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker and actress Fay Ripley reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include white-van drivers, competitive parents and people who tell the truth.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Outdoor survival expert Ray Mears, TV presenter Fiona Bruce and comedienne Katherine Ryan tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include caravans, cushions on beds and Cheryl.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack's not having much luck with lights these days, whether it's the fizzling sign at the start of this show, the blackout during his recent Sheffield gig, or the dimly lit area at the start of this seventh series. Lee and Lucy have enjoyed a spot of culture at their local cinema, but the sparkle of a French movie is soon diminished when the romantic walk home finds them in an imposing underpass. She has her handbag stolen by a bunch of cocky youths from under his nose. Given the fact the layabout failed to protect her, or come up with an accurate description of their muggers, Lee feels the urge to prove his manliness, but will a spell at the local boxing ring be a help or a hindrance? Sally Bretton and Katy Wix also star.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A wealthy new couple move into the block and soon find out that sharing a building with Lee and Lucy is anything but straightforward. The fun begins when Lee somehow manages to bag an invitation to a christening party being thrown by the couple - sending him and Lucy on a last-minute gift-buying trip, during which they make every wrong decision humanly possible to find the perfect present for the baby who seems to have everything. Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden join the cast, with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy decides she wants to have a baby, but what she didn't expect was for the whole family to take a personal interest in the conception. Lee thinks he should be the one, of course - so he can't believe it when she reveals she is planning to have the child with another man. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star, with Katy Wix, Bobby Ball, Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Gary Delaney and Zoe Lyons join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for another round of the satirical news quiz from July 2012.

programme.title: Big Zuu's Big Eats
programme.desc: Big Zuu is going regal as he heads to Royal Leamington Spa to meet and eat with comedian and actor Guz Khan. Leamington was once a place Queen Victoria visited, now it's the mandems turn.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Milton Jones and Ava Vidal join Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for the comedy panel show taking aim at the week's news from July 2012.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Conservative MP Johnny Mercer and comedian Zoe Lyons joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave suggests revamping the calendar and considers the upshot of buying Twitter followers.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Charlie Higson, Sally Phillips, Johnny Vaughan and Ellie Taylor take their seats at the table with Alan to discuss such varied topics as Josh Hartnett and escapes from oil rigs.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Some of the unseen moments, from Matt Lucas destroying a UK clothing brand to what happens when Russell Kane eats too much curry.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: A team of scientists launch a probe to touch the sun and make a surprise discovery on the tiny planet Mercury.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: Wild North
programme.desc: Documentary examining three landscapes in northern Scandinavia. In the mountainous highlands, cameras capture two endangered predators relying on a plentiful supply of lemmings.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough shines the spotlight on some of nature's evolutionary anomalies and how these curious animals continue to baffle and fascinate. In this edition, he examines the unusual ways in which Komodo dragons and aphids reproduce.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the vision in squid and owls, which have both developed incredible adaptations to help them navigate at night.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at gorillas and vampire bats, two species that have unfairly gained unpleasant reputation within the animal kingdom.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Tower of London
programme.desc: An exploration of British landmarks, beginning with a look at the Tower of London - which has served as a castle, a jail and a place of execution.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Bren has a bad day - a convict escapes in the fog on his way to Strangeways, the blood donor van turns up at the factory, and Tony's holiday photos cause upset. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Andrew Dunn.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: The staff have a bet on Bren's chances of romance with Tony, but the hapless cook's past finally catches up with her and threatens to ruin any prospects of romance. Meanwhile, Stan is furious with Philippa for failing to save the bulbs from last year's Christmas tree lights. Comedy, written by and starring Victoria Wood, with Thelma Barlow, Andrew Dunn, Celia Imrie and Shobna Gulati.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Twinkle and Stan spoil Petula's plans for a peaceful family Christmas, and a baby is found abandoned near the canteen. Bren's romance with Tony is ruined by the unexpected reappearance of her husband, and Anita goes away - but leaves her inflatable man behind. Festive special from 1999, starring Victoria Wood.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: The Mystical Boudoir of Nurse Gladys Emmanuel
programme.desc: Arkwright hatches a plan to get into Nurse Gladys's bedroom by forcing a reluctant Granville to masquerade as a burglar, so the miserly shopkeeper can come to her rescue. Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron star.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason. Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville tries to persuade Arkwright to buy a van, as he is fed up with having to struggle doing the rounds with the shop's outdated delivery bike. He is pleasantly surprised when his skinflint uncle agrees - until he takes the vehicle out on the road. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates historical evidence of the story of Jesus, examining his execution and his relationship with Mary Magdalene.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: How Second World War criminal Adolf Eichmann was tracked down to Buenos Aires, Argentina, in 1961.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system..

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit the Royal William Yard in Plymouth, where they are given the chance to cast their eyes over a number of potentially valuable items. On the waterfront, militaria expert Graham Lay has doubts about a pair of doorknobs thought to have belonged to Admiral Horatio Nelson. The team is impressed by a chess set made from parts of the aircraft carrier HMS Ark Royal, and a psychedelic painting of a band that performed at Woodstock intrigues Clive Stewart-Lockhart. Plus, jewellery specialist John Benjamin marvels at a diamond necklace the length of a skipping rope, donated to the city of Plymouth by Lady Astor.

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy narrates a documentary examining the lives of animals and people pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic, from the world's most powerful currents, ferocious hurricanes and huge chains of undersea volcanoes. The first episode looks at the influence of the Gulf Stream, with whales, giant turtles and jellyfish riding the huge current that becomes a migration super-highway and helps warm northern Europe, while fishermen battle for survival in mountainous seas as they try to exploit its natural fertility.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of omnivores, nature's generalists, revealing their myriad talents in the wild and how some species have adapted to man's encroachment into their habitats by making their homes in cities and towns.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever, including technology that allows the navigation of the winding mountains of Spain at speed..

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The hunt for Gestapo head Klaus Barbie and death camp guard John Demjanjuk, dubbed 'The Butcher of Lyon' and 'Ivan the Terrible' respectively, which lasted into the 1980s.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn follows his family's roots by exploring Metroland, the area around the Metropolitan Railway, and in Great Malvern learns about the woman behind a decorative 1860s station.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: The Mystical Boudoir of Nurse Gladys Emmanuel
programme.desc: Arkwright hatches a plan to get into Nurse Gladys's bedroom by forcing a reluctant Granville to masquerade as a burglar, so the miserly shopkeeper can come to her rescue. Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie secretly buys a load of artificial fertiliser to help his supposedly organic crops - but is seen unloading it by a neighbour, who promptly phones the Agricultural Office to complain about his behaviour. Starring John Challis.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: The local mayor becomes embroiled in a sex scandal, so Boycie decides to stand for election as his replacement - unaware Llewellyn is planning to do the same. Marlene is put in a tight spot when a schoolfriend of Tyler's confesses he has developed feelings for her. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: Documentary about the Holocaust and some of the key figures involved, beginning with Hjalmar Schacht, who was never a Nazi but played a vital role in Hitler's plans.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The story of the Ahnenerbe research institute, which was set up to provide scientific backing to Hitler's ideology, through a series of horrific experiments.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Stasi: Behind the Berlin Wall
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston looks behind the hidden remnants of the Berlin Wall, a notorious symbol of division, to tell the story of the Stasi, East Germany's State Security Service.

programme.desc: The hunt for Gestapo head Klaus Barbie and death camp guard John Demjanjuk, dubbed 'The Butcher of Lyon' and 'Ivan the Terrible' respectively, which lasted into the 1980s.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents from Plymouth's Royal William Yard. Items brought in to be valued include a ceremonial wooden spoon presented to the student who got the worst exam results in the history of Cambridge University, one of the last flasks of naval rum to be produced, a book of designs by a famous landscape gardener, a ceremonial hammer and chisel and some dolls' house furniture. One visitor discovers the brooch she bought in a charity shop is much older than she thought.

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Documentary examining the animals pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic. In the vast South Atlantic, huge pods of dolphins, massive penguin colonies and the largest gathering of marine mammals on Earth pack chains of extraordinary islands, created by powerful volcanic forces far below them. Meanwhile, the nutrient-rich upwellings create profusions of life in some areas, and the abyssal depths host a world of bizarre creatures in others.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough swims alongside sea otters, discovering he is no match for their natural agility in the water, while in Florida he takes a dip with manatees for the first time and observes their feeding habits. On the coast of California, he encounters the largest mammals on the planet, blue whales, and reveals how they, along with porpoises and dolphins, learned to court, mate and give birth in the water.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador..

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's former deputy Hermann Goering, who emerged from house arrest in May 1945 and made his way to American lines in the hope of surrendering to them rather than the Russians. After being imprisoned at Nuremberg, he committed suicide by poisoning in October 1946.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: In 1925 the SS Cotopaxi carrying coal and 32 men vanished. It has since become synonymous with one of the ocean's greatest mysteries - the Bermuda Triangle.

programme.title: From World War to Cold War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring the end of the Second World War, and how the plans for the future agreed by the Allied nations at the Yalta Conference in 1945 broke down.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates what Hitler intended to do with the priceless works of art stolen by the Nazis from across Europe, as well as his obsession with religious artefacts.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Bolsover Castle in Derbyshire. Finds on display include original illustrations for Roald Dahl's book Fantastic Mr Fox, a set of motorcyclist Barry Sheene's racing leathers, a collection of Star Wars toys, a mysterious metal rod that proves to be far more valuable than it appears and a miniature house used for training plumbers. A visitor to the show tries to find a glass figure for her mother, to replace one that exploded.

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Life in the tropical Atlantic, where everything from dolphins, manatees and whale sharks to sunbathing jellyfish thrive in the Caribbean's warm, sheltered waters, fringed by coral reefs and rich mangrove forests. But when extreme heat in Africa unleashes terrifying hurricanes, all hell breaks loose across the region.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough profiles the tree-dwellers of the animal kingdom, as primates, bats and squirrels perform complicated manoeuvres in the world's forests. Whether aided by sharp claws, webbed feet or gripping tails, these animals play a complicated game of survival with predators lurking below, ready to make a meal of those who fail to stay aloft.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. programme.desc: Sandra and her seasoned colleagues reopen the case of a political aide's murder when a dormant offshore bank account containing 40,000 is discovered in his name. But neither his mother nor his best friend was able to identify the mystery woman. Is she the key to the crime? Drama, with former Brookside star John McArdle (Billy Corkhill), Jason Durr of Heartbeat fame and one-time Bad Girls actress Kika Mirylees joining Denis Lawson, Dennis Waterman and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.desc: Sanjay's trying to speak to Gita but she's still too upset about his affair. David Wicks is introducing himself round the square and aunt Nellie arrives at the Fowlers.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A bungled burglary leads to a gruesome task for the Blue Watch team, and Dutch firefighter Marianne joins the watch on exchange.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Dr Jack Kerruish leaves Africa hoping to become a country GP, while Beth Glover and Will Preston are looking for a partner to join their Derbyshire practice. First episode of the rural medical drama, starring Kevin Whately, Amanda Burton and.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ozias Harding makes his presence felt in Skelthwaite by ruthlessly firing Alan from the factory, while Luke is rushed to hospital after a serious accident on the rugby field, and Beth has a chance to test her maternal instincts when she is asked to lead the children's Moon Catching Expedition. Starring Brian Capron, Keith Barron, Christian Cooke and Kerrie Taylor.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie discovers a medieval recipe for traditional liquor among some ancient scrolls and goes into full-scale production, building a distillery in his barn and buying up all the potatoes he can find. The business goes well, but his success attracts some unwelcome visitors - the Driscoll brothers. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Mysterious Feet of Nora Batty
programme.desc: Wally is called upon to settle an argument between Compo and Foggy - the exact size of Nora Batty's feet. Bill Owen, Kathy Staff and Joe Gladwin star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The discovery of an abandoned mattress leads Foggy to embark on an town-wide clean-up campaign. Brian Glover guest stars in the rural comedy, with Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: A black man is murdered in a jail cell by a confirmed racist - a crime the prison service blames on overcrowding. However, the judge's probing reveals the institution wasn't operating at full capacity. A drink-driving appeal puts the bench at loggerheads, and Jo distances herself from her former lover. With Donald Sinden and Jenny Seagrove.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A photo featuring a missing 19-year-old music student turns up in a charity shop donation bag on the anniversary of her disappearance 17 years earlier, prompting Sandra to suspect the work of a serial killer. However, as the team gets to work identifying and tracking down the other people in the picture, increasing pressure to hand over the investigation forces Sandra to consider her future, and she turns to a familiar face to help her make her decision. Amanda Redman stars, with Denis Lawson, Dennis Waterman and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan is assigned to investigate the case of two murdered teenage girls whose frozen bodies have been uncovered by an avalanche in Norway. Post-mortem results show they were strangled 15 years apart and as investigations proceed, suspicion falls on a friend of one victim's family. Drama, starring Amanda Burton and Anthony Head.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Elizabeth struggles through her labour, while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Negotiations are jeopardised by a twist of fate, and Lizzie learns she has more in common with her husband than she first imagined. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The York princesses are strategically married off to strengthen the Tudor cause, but further political challenges are on the horizon. When King Henry finds himself back on the battlefield to protect his reign, Lizzie learns that the threats they face may be closer to home. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The fusiliers return to the UK and take up guard duty at Windsor Castle, while also preparing to take part in a memorial ceremony for the anniversary of the D-Day landings.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A football match is cut short when trouble arises. Elsewhere, Nelson has problems with his girlfriend, and Paddy faces a few home truths.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jo Masters and Samantha Nixon continue to hunt for the missing Lesley Palmer - a case given added urgency by the subsequent disappearance of her ex-boyfriend Stewart Jenson. Smithy and Laura Bryant discover the unidentified hospital patient is June's real son, while Terry Perkins and Phil Hunter investigate a sudden death - but soon find they also have a burglary on their hands.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Gina asks for more help from Connie as she plans her trip to Switzerland for an assisted suicide, leaving the surgeon with a difficult moral dilemma. Ric learns Bradley has been receiving gifts from the hospital's drug supplier, and the pair's investigation into the medication problem uncovers a counterfeit pill-maker in the warehouse.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Duffy is less than impressed when her doctor husband makes a dramatic entrance on his first day at the hospital, and wonders whether their marriage can survive the stress of a professional relationship. Charlie is forced to come to terms with giving up Louis as he prepares to take the youngster to Canada, and Chloe regrets telling Spencer about Barney's alcoholic father. Medical drama, starring Cathy Shipton and Derek Thompson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Smithy discovers Gabriel's real name is actually David Kent. Understandably taken aback, he nevertheless prevents June from telling Okaro. Unfortunately Laura also knows the truth, and lacks his resolve. Filled with righteous indignation, she blurts out the entire sorry saga to a shell-shocked Sheelagh - who blunders headlong into danger as she investigates. On the professional front, Terry investigates an attack on his sister-in-law.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Jerry's furious with Meena after Gita told him she had an affair with Sanjay. Jules is back in the square and is looking for Hattie. Aunt Nellie causes tension at the Fowler's..

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team races to extinguish a blazing marquee at a school fete, but their new gold uniforms make them a laughing-stock for the other crews in attendance.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: The Beeches finally becomes a paying concern - but Beth's relief at its new-found solvency is cut short by the discovery that a rival fund-holding trust is stealing patients at an alarming rate. Her frustration is tempered by a growing attraction to newcomer Jack Kerruish - but his professional approach continues to be a source of friction. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna is unsure whether she should tell Luke the truth about his chances of recovery after his near-fatal rugby accident, and Ozias Harding's persistent bullying forces Billy to resign from the factory, leading Nathan to take revenge against the businessman by asking out his daughter Alice. Lesley Dunlop, Brian Capron and Andrew Paul star.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon's husband Chris becomes seriously ill, leaving her facing a difficult decision. Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph star in an episode featuring an early screen appearance by Doon Mackichan.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie senses an opportunity to get himself knighted when Marlene becomes heavily involved in charity work. Enlisting the help of their staff, Marlene tries to make it happen using her contacts, but achieving her husband's dream turns out to be harder than expected. Comedy, starring John Challis.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In his latest attempt to impress Nora Batty, Compo borrows Crusher Milburn's bright red motorcycle and dons racing leathers to become a daredevil biker. Comedy, starring Bill Owen, with Kathy Staff.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy, Compo and Clegg spot Digby chasing his donkey around his paddock. Foggy claims that a little planning will see the beast caught, and volunteers the trio to complete the task. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The detective looks into the suspicious death of an old friend and informant. The investigation leads him to the local police station, where it becomes clear the officers are hiding something - and to complicate matters, the disappearance of a teenage boy is also linked to the case. Crime drama, with Martin Shaw, Lee Ingleby and guest stars Neil Pearson, Dean Lennox Kelly and Mark Benton.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: After Sandra's departure, the detectives are anxious to meet their new boss, and DCI Sasha Miller wastes no time getting cracking with her first Ucos case, the murder of an Italian immigrant on a west London allotment 25 years earlier. The ritualistic style of the killing puts one of the other gardeners in the frame when it's revealed he is a practising druid. However, as the investigation continues, Gerry becomes suspicious of Sasha - why is she kissing a senior officer? Tamzin Outhwaite joins the cast as DCI Miller, with Dennis Waterman, Denis Lawson and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan suspects foul play when she is called in to investigate the apparent suicide of a headmaster's wife. Attempting to arrange a special autopsy, she finds that her superiors don't share her view, appearing more concerned with her failing health _ and without the evidence she needs, a murderer could still be at large. Feature-length episode of the drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Lizzie must deal with her mother's bold defence of the York cause, while the appearance of a boy in Burgundy claiming to be a young prince threatens to further destabilise King Henry's rule. King Henry's mother Lady Margaret Beaufort faces the consequences of harbouring a dark secret. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII and Lizzie travel to Spain to secure their son's betrothal, but find news of their country's instability has preceded them. Meanwhile, unrest growing in Burgundy spills over into an English battle. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy Garvey is awarded his medal at Buckingham Palace, and an old flame returns into Major James McCudden's life. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.desc: Smithy discovers Gabriel's real name is actually David Kent. Understandably taken aback, he nevertheless prevents June from telling Okaro. programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Schoolchildren bring in their cuddly toys for a taste of hospital life, although Holly's enthusiasm isn't shared by her colleagues. Meanwhile, Charlie reluctantly books his flight to Toronto, and faces a difficult decision when Chloe and Barney vie for the same post. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson, Jan Anderson and Sandra Huggett.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: David Kent returns home unexpectedly and catches wife-to-be Sheelagh going through his belongings. Later, as a horrified June looks on, he and Smithy settle their differences once and for all - in a life-or-death struggle on the roof of a tower block.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon receives some bad news from abroad. Aunt Nellie continues to ruffle the feathers of many in Albert Square and Frank makes David a proposition.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle has some news for Sanjay about Gita. Nigel continues his hospital visits.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A devastating blaze sweeps through George's gym. Meanwhile, the team are called to help a man who is stuck up a tree.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack treats an athlete whose sudden pre-race injury seems just a little too convenient to be true _ and uncovers a heartbreaking tale of woe. Kevin Whately stars as the Derbyshire medic.

programme.desc: Luke arrives back home in a wheelchair, but quickly becomes frustrated and takes his anger out on David. Charlie tries to avoid his daughter Charlotte when she returns from Italy and Nathan convinces Alice to keep their relationship secret - a move which drives her to accept a date with Joe.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: In a bid to raise some cash for Christmas, Tracey falls back on her typing skills, while Sharon reckons there is a gap in the market for her own unique brand of pet care.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Animal rights activists target the village, with Llewellyn falling victim to a paint bomb and the pub coming under threat, so Boycie organises patrol groups to protect Winderdown farm from attack. Meanwhile, Tyler wants to borrow money to buy equipment for his band, but Boycie refuses until his son completes a task to prove his business acumen.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Woollen Mills of Your Mind
programme.desc: Compo takes up marathon running, hoping that it will persuade Nora Batty to fall into his arms. Long-running rural comedy, starring Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's Looking After the Cafe Then?
programme.desc: Ivy goes out for the afternoon - leaving Foggy to supervise Crusher and ensure the cafe runs smoothly. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Jane Freeman and Jonathan Linsley.

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: The detective cancels a planned break in the company of his close friend Agatha Troy after being hauled into the assistant commissioner's office and ordered to investigate the death of a man found clad in monks' robes in a convent. The apparent murder coincides with the theft of a priceless chalice, testing the sleuth's powers of deduction to their full extent. Crime drama, guest starring David Haig, with Patrick Malahide.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The detectives are asked to carry out a preliminary investigation into a corrupt senior officer who may have suppressed evidence when a notorious crime boss was put away for murdering a prominent doctor. However, Sasha feels torn because she is almost certain that eight years earlier the convict in question also killed her CID partner. Meanwhile, Steve gets a shock when his estranged son turns up at work to see him. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam Ryan investigates the grisly discovery of a severed arm following a traffic collision, assisted by new morgue colleague Leo Dalton. As DCI Deacon arrives at the scene, Sam notices she is expressing an unusual interest in one of the bodies, leading her to believe her colleague could be withholding an important piece of evidence. Meanwhile, new junior pathologist Harry Cunningham faces a trying time when he finds out his first autopsy will be performed on a child.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: A pretender to the throne is held captive at court, confounding the Tudors, and creating a new rift in Lizzie and King Henry's marriage. Lizzie faces an impossible choice, and makes a risky move to try to eliminate the threat to her family. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The pretender exposes King Henry's weaknesses, while Lizzie confronts new demons and old curses. Concluding the sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages as the War of the Roses comes to an end. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The hospital holds an emergency drill to see how the staff would cope with a terrorist attack, but tensions within the team prove a barrier to them working well together. programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Barney is aghast to learn health assistant Spencer knows about his alcoholic father, and wastes no time in accusing Chloe of telling tales. Meanwhile, Duffy confides in Colette that she may be pregnant again, a group of students holds a teacher hostage in a derelict house and a patient unwittingly brings a black widow spider into the department. Medical drama, starring Ben Keaton, Ronnie McCann and Catherine Shipton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Leela investigates a 'happy slapping' incident. Tracing the teenage culprits to a nearby school, she finds they show no remorse. Amber, Ramani and Zain look into a case of domestic violence, only to find the circumstances aren't as clear-cut as they initially appeared. Back at the station, Dan Casper is teased about his seemingly non-existent love life, and Adam tries to quell gossip about the bogus Gabriel Kent's fatal fall.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil has moved into his new flat and he has a proposition for Kathy.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian wants to take Cindy on a romantic night out and Ricky tries his hand at selling cars.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Three months after the crash, the Blue Watch team has returned to duty, just in time to deal with an inferno on a private railway line.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Idealistic GP Jack Kerruish tries to help a childless couple _ and learns a harsh lesson on the realities of country life. Medical drama, starring Amanda Burton and Kevin Whately.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A patient's wife accuses Sally of having an affair with her husband, putting pressure on the nurse's career and marriage, while Nathan and Joe find out the truth about Alice's two-timing and a bored Alan discovers he has won the star prize on a scratch card. Ex-EastEnder Martin Kemp guest stars.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Dorien takes her antique silver samovar to the Antiques Roadshow, inspiring the sisters to search for their own family heirlooms - and soon they make a surprising discovery.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Tyler falls into a deep depression after his girlfriend leaves him, spending every hour painting gloomy pictures and starving himself. Marlene enlists Jed and Bryan to help her son mend his broken heart, but when matters do not improve, the responsibility falls to her mother, Dora. Guest starring June Whitfield.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Why Does Norman Clegg Buy Ladies' Elastic Stockings?
programme.desc: Howard asks a reluctant Clegg to deliver a message to Marina at her place of employment. Meanwhile, Seymour goes in search of oil, but manages to drill through a water main. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Michael Aldridge.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour takes it upon himself to supervise repairs to a boat, and together with Clegg tries to persuade Compo to take up canoeing to improve his physique. Comedy, starring Michael Aldridge, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Luella race against the clock when undertaker Peter Quintus is given only 24 hours to live after a visit by two mysterious hitmen - Mr R and Mr G.

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: A volunteer in the Lighthaven lifeboat crew drowns following a hoax call-out, and Jane suspects foul play, despite Davey's scepticism.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Back home in Bermondsey for his youngest daughter's wedding, Gerry is visited by Ralph Paxton, an old friend recently released from prison who wants him investigate the murder of his grandson. Meanwhile, a newly divorced Sasha is forced to work with ex-husband Ned Hancock, Danny puts the body language skills he has acquired on an FBI course to the test, and Gerry's daughter Caitlin gets upset when her father interrogates her fiance about his credentials. Cold case drama, starring Dennis Waterman, Tamzin Outhwaite and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by David Hayman (Trial & Retribution).

programme.desc: Peggy is aghast to learn Stephen has been indulging in extracurricular activities with one of his teachers, and orders her to break off the affair or get out of town. Drama, starring Pam Ferris, Sarah Lancashire and Tony Haygarth.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Vic Snow makes a new friend, while Ruth's baby son Alfie is snatched by one of the residents at a local nursing home and taken on a bizarre trek over freezing-cold Skelthwaite Moors - in the general direction of the local reservoir. Popular drama, starring Sarah Lancashire, Pam Ferris, Tony Haygarth and Thomas Craig.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer attempts to sell dodgy prints to a friend of Lady Jane Felsham - only to learn Eric has procured a bronze statue in a house on a pig farm famously stolen from Her Majesty the Queen. Drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: Who Is the Fairest of Them All?
programme.desc: The antiques dealer is asked to sell a sinister-looking mirror from a ballet school, and determines to finally marry Lady Jane. However, the object of his affections has some shocking news for him that suggests he may have left matters too late. Roger Lloyd Pack (Trigger in Only Fools and Horses) guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Richard Sharpe and the faithful Harper begin their latest tour of duty by uncovering top-level corruption in the Army. Reporting their findings leads to attempts on their lives, so they fake their own deaths and re-enlist under new identities in an attempt to expose the culprits. Guest starring Julian Fellowes and featuring Alexander Armstrong in an early role.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Dennis's first task as gaffer is to pick up a valuable antique bath from Fidel Castro's country residence and bring it back to Havana as a gift to the ambassador. Despite having made other plans for their day off, the lads reluctantly agree to join him, and a bite to eat at the Cuban leader's expense helps to lift their spirits - but Barry, Oz and Neville disappear en route. Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A besotted Oz persuades the gang to do a spot of moonlighting by helping renovate Ofelia's rundown home. Wyman takes a leaf out of his late father's book by seducing embassy worker Tina. Meanwhile, Neville's loyalties are tested when he is ordered to spy on a Manchester United fan, and Dennis begins to feel left out. Jimmy Nail, Tim Healy and Kevin Whately star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to create a garden as a wedding present, and find a baby under a gooseberry bush. The discovery brings out Rosemary's maternal side as the pair investigate who abandoned the child. Their task is complicated by the murder of an artistic neighbour - and the two mysterious incidents appear to be connected. Starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo visit a resort in Spain to create a trophy garden for a pro-am tennis tournament run by a former champion. When one of the competitors is found dead, everyone assumes it to be a gruesome accident - but there is more to the case than meets the eye. While investigating, Laura enters the mysterious world of bullfighting, and Rosemary rediscovers her love of motor scooters.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered amateur detectives work on a garden for an open-air theatre, where Rosemary's cousin is due to perform. However, the production suffers a setback when an actor shoots himself during rehearsal - and the gun is found to have contained live bullets instead of blanks. A member of the cast gets an attack of stage fright, and Laura is obliged to take her place in the play as the duo try to find the culprit. Drama, with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: An avid cyclist suffers a massive coronary at the top of a local mountain, but with astronomical levels of caffeine in his system, there is more to his death than meets the eye.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Sid falls for the heiress to a local brewery, only for her to be arrested for the murder of her own father. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: After three months back in 2010, Alex is desperate to return to the 1980s, where Gene is on the run accused of trying to kill her, and the team is in disarray with Ray promoted to DI and a child's kidnapping to investigate. As the past merges into the present, she is visited by the ghost of a dead policeman and realises there are still dark secrets to unearth. Drama, starring Keeley Hawes and Philip Glenister.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A serial killer targets women signed up to a dating agency, so Alex puts aside her examination of Sam Tyler's death back in Manchester to go undercover. However, as it becomes clear that Shaz matches the profile of previous victims, she steps forward to snare the murderer - an act set to be her last as a police officer. Fantasy crime drama, starring Keeley Hawes and Monserrat Lombard, with Beth Goddard.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A reluctant Brian enters an addiction centre run by monks to treat his alcoholism, but soon becomes bored and looks for a distraction. He finds one when a chance remark leads the team to reopen an investigation into the death of a heroin user nine years previously - and to help reveal the truth, Gerry is sent undercover as a sex addict. Richard Wilson and Fay Ripley guest star.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: Drama based on the last days of cult leader David Koresh, and the 51-day siege between February and April 1993 at a compound belonging to his religious sect. In the first episode, the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms (ATF) receives a tip-off of suspicious activity involving weapons taking place among a small religious community led by David Koresh at the Mount Carmel Center, located just outside of Waco, Texas. Starring Taylor Kitsch, Michael Shannon, Melissa Benoist and John Leguizamo.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: ATF agent Jacob Vasquez begins undercover surveillance on the Mount Carmel compound and befriends David Koresh in hope of finding illegal weapons or other activity.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: With the ATF siege in motion, assault vehicles storm the Mount Carmel compound and exchange gunfire, which begins a 51-day stand-off.

Smithy and Laura Bryant discover the unidentified hospital patient is June's real son, while Terry Perkins and Phil Hunter investigate a sudden death - but soon find they also have a burglary on their hands.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Smithy discovers Gabriel's real name is actually David Kent. Understandably taken aback, he nevertheless prevents June from telling Okaro. Unfortunately Laura also knows the truth, and lacks his resolve. Filled with righteous indignation, she blurts out the entire sorry saga to a shell-shocked Sheelagh - who blunders headlong into danger as she investigates. On the professional front, Terry investigates an attack on his sister-in-law.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: David Kent returns home unexpectedly and catches wife-to-be Sheelagh going through his belongings. Realising time is running out, he resorts to desperate measures and tries to kill the real Gabriel. Later, as a horrified June looks on, he and Smithy settle their differences once and for all - in a life-or-death struggle on the roof of a tower block.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: A young Idris Elba puts in an appearance at the Thrift Infirmary, as Lady Cora's pregnant maid is rushed in with labour pains, causing Robert's reluctant return..

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor comes up against the governors of the East London Hospital when they threaten to take over the Thrift. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Man Who Cried
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama about Abel Mason, an ordinary working man whose extramarital affair leads to murder, and prompts him to hit the road with his son in search of a new life. The pair head north and Abel eventually finds employment with a wealthy garage owner. Ciaran Hinds and Kate Buffery star.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah is concerned about the risks involved in Rene's brain operation and refuses to give her consent, while George steps down as the Country Party candidate and attempts to face his demons regarding his strained relationship with his father. Elizabeth comes home from Sydney to attend Georgie's christening and Gino is worried about his vine saplings.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: James's continued absence leaves Olivia distraught on the morning of Georgie's christening. An anxious Sarah is comforted by Dr Fox.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth spots a strange man in Elizabeth's house and becomes convinced he has spent the night there.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth's wealthy acquaintance Mrs Fortescue, whose sister married a baronet, asks her for a lift into town - but things do not go according to plan. Patricia Routledge stars.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth plans a candlelit supper to impress Emmet with her singing talents, but fate intervenes and the event does not go as expected. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and David Griffin.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner is reunited with a couple whose daughter was born without limbs, and takes them to a specialist unit where she can be fitted for prosthetics. However, while the experience helps the girl's mother to realise that she is not alone, it proves traumatic for the father, who blames his wife for his child's condition. Nurse Crane takes charge of Sister Winifred's driving lessons, and Trixie thinks Christopher is hiding something from her.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.desc: Simon's dead body is found by the river, leaving everyone in a state of shock. Harrow is surprised about all the things he did not know about his protege. The investigator also attends the scene of an accidental electrocution, whom it transpires was the last person Simon spoke to last before his death. Ioan Gruffudd stars.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A body found hanging in the children's playground of a recently regenerated model community proves to be that of a member of the local Community Watch scheme. Suspicion falls on the chairman of the organisation Harry Wallace, a founding father who helped clean up the estate for the residents. Reid fights to clear the local hero's name, but her colleagues are not so easily impressed when it emerges he has form for accidentally killing a man. Glasgow-set detective drama, guest starring Phil McKee, with Blythe Duff.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Enlisting the help of a UFO-spotter, the team discovers the reporter witnessed a mysterious air crash near a US Air Force base, and the retired officers try to track down the original personnel to get some answers. Guest starring Mark Williams, Glynis Barber, Michael Brandon and Raquel Cassidy, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: The Branch Davidians refuse to surrender, while David Koresh waits for a sign from God and his followers are tested by a lack of food and medicine.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: The end of the stalemate seems to approach as the FBI's tactical division turns up the heat.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: Attorneys visit David Koresh and his followers to discuss the case at hand and options. However, the stand-off at the Mount Carmel compound ultimtely comes to a violent and tragic end. Taylor Kitsch and Michael Shannon star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Don't Ask Me Ask Britain
programme.desc: Interactive comedy game show hosted by Alexander Armstrong, which uses an app to poll the viewing public on moral dilemmas big and small, while two celebrity teams go head to head to try and second guess the views of the nation.

programme.desc: The latest on the coronavirus pandemic with Lorraine Kelly, including medical advice and stories of how people are coping with the lockdown.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five naval officers from HMS Queen Elizabeth answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show which takes place in public locations around the UK. He invites passers-by in Essex to take part in a series of unusual challenges, with a prize of 1,000 up for grabs.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Harriet feels a fraud regarding Will, Mandy steels herself to protect her son and Paul almost blows his cover.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Oliver's recovery hits a setback and David continues his quest for kicks when he approaches some youths on bikes and purposely shoves one of them over. James struggles with locker-room banter and Gemma shows Chesney her vlog, but makes it clear she has no intention of putting it online after her humiliating turnstile experience.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossain puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Advice on growing fruit and vegetables, with Alan sharing the tips and tricks he uses on his own plot, with his Love Your Garden team members Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney joining in from their homes. From seriously stylish ways to grow veg anywhere to practical tips on what to plant and where, they show how to get gardens bursting with fruit, salad, herbs and vegetables to supply the table for the year ahead and beyond.

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: Family and friends attend the funeral of 11-year-old Rhys Jones as he is laid to rest, while a police raid at the home of Kevin Moody leads to the recovery of the gun used in the schoolboy's murder. Moody must choose between being labelled a grass and risking violent retribution or protecting the killer and facing jail time. But an unexpected result from the forensic tests on the firearm leaves the entire investigation hanging in the balance. Fact-based drama, starring Stephen Graham and Michael Moran.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Tommy Cooper Forever
programme.desc: Part two of two. Singer and actress Anita Harris retraces her footsteps back to the London Palladium where she worked with Tommy. Comedian Les Dennis makes an emotional trip back to Her Majesty's Theatre to remember the night he saw Tommy's final performance. Plus, how Cooper became an unlikely comedy hero on Dutch TV in the 1960s.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 1989 Liverpool v Arsenal Title Decider - ITV Football Classic
programme.desc: Elton Welsby presents extended highlights of the memorable match at Anfield, which saw Arsenal needing to win by at least two goals to pip their opponents to the title. With analysis from Bobby Robson, reports by Jim Rosenthal and commentary from Brian Moore and David Pleat.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: The second week of the cookery gameshow continues as chef Rosemary Shrager takes over as guest judge. First, she challenges the contestants to show off their knife skills as they are tasked to slice carrots into thin strips or juliennes, with three contenders being sent home after this initial round. The remaining cooks are then challenged to prepare a squid in 10 minutes, before creating a dish of their own using the freshly prepared squid in the final round.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Drama series, starring Martin Clunes as a surgeon who takes up a post in a sleepy Cornish village. Martin has to rush Buddy the dog to the vets. Meanwhile, Mrs Tishell's young cousin Sarah joins her for some work experience, but it does not go to plan, and one of Louisa's clients arrives at the surgery unannounced, posing a dilemma.

credits.actor: Martin Clunes as a surgeon who takes up a post in a sleepy Cornish village

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson steps into Chris Tarrant's shoes to host the first edition of the revival of the quiz. Contestants sit in the famous chair to answer a maximum of 15 questions, hoping to win 1million and join original millionaires Judith Keppel, David Edwards, Robert Brydges, Pat Gibson and Ingram Wilcox. Each player has four lifelines - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50:50 and Ask the Host - at their disposal.

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: When potential witness Claire Olssen is intimidated into changing her statement, the investigation team look for alternative ways to reinforce their case. As Steve returns to work, Kelly is offered a deal that tests his resolve.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals
programme.desc: Documentary revealing how Queen Elizabeth II has mastered the art of being a monarch, both home and abroad, over her record-breaking 68-year reign. She is seen meeting world leaders such as Ronald Reagan, Mikhail Gorbachev and Donald Trump - although not all encounters go well, and the film also looks at the Queen's commitment to the Commonwealth, a personal project that has seen the old Empire transformed.

programme.title: Secrets of the Driving Test
programme.desc: Cocksure 17-year-old Bethany is barely out of the test centre before getting into a game of chicken. Drew and Julie are back and eager to improve on their catastrophic first tests, while in Blackpool, retired policeman Philip is hoping a pass will finally stop his wife telling him how to drive.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Fern Britton hosts another culinary showdown, judged this week by Rosemary Shrager, who begins by demonstrating how to peel, cut and slice pears into fans, before giving the contestants five minutes to copy what she has just done. Six hopefuls go through to the next stage where they have to French trim pork chops, before the final three use the meat to create the best pork dish they can.

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jamie and Andrea return, Moira is stung by Cain, and Mandy wants Paul to go.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: David is chased by an angry mob and cornered in an alleyway, while the doctor warns Leanne that it is too soon to be sure, but Oliver may have suffered brain damage. Tommy Orpington assures James he did the right thing coming out, and Chesney urges Gemma to share her vlog online.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Manchester-born brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on an epic journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the fifth episode, Adam attempts to master an ancient sport when he and Scott get a taste of Indian parklife. Elsewhere, Ryan and Dougie make a shock discovery about Dougie's grandmother, before the group join in with the festivities for the country's biggest party for Diwali.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul helps to feed a pair of week-old kittens whose mother has abandoned them. However, as the kittens grow older, the team discover that one of them has a neurological problem affecting his movement. Later, Paul meets a group of dogs from a puppy farm who have had very little human interaction in the past, and need help learning how to socialise.

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: Mercer and his associates are tried for their roles in the killing of 11-year-old Rhys Jones, but the verdict fails to bring closure for the boy's parents Melanie and Steve as the fractures in their relationship come to a head. Meanwhile an unexpected setback leaves Det Supt Dave Kelly with a tough decision to make. The concluding part of the fact-based drama centred on the devastating impact of a child's murder amid a wave of gang violence in Liverpool, starring Stephen Graham, Sinead Keenan and Bran F O'Byrne.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five golfing friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Freeze Out
programme.desc: Game show of skill and quizzing ability in which contestants compete at a giant circular ice table for the chance to manoeuvre gliding sliders on a giant game board, hoping to eventually secure a jackpot of 10,000. programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates another comical selection of mishaps sent in by viewers, featuring accidents filmed using the latest technology only - no camcorder clips or pixelated phone videos in sight. Tonight, a man is accidentally tasered, a couple set their kitchen on fire, and a toddler in an electric car runs amok in a shopping centre.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Family
programme.desc: Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty presents as eight celebrity families take part in the knockout tournament, hoping to win 25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family. The first episode is a battle of the soaps, as Coronation Street's Lucy Fallon (Bethany Platt) and her family take on former EastEnders star Shaun Williamson (Barry Evans) and his clan. Two new rounds have been added to this celebrity spin on the format - including an Observation round featuring cartoon images of Anne that put their memories to the test.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Scammers: Hunting the Lockdown Criminals - Tonight
programme.desc: There has been a spike in internet fraud - from fake goods and services to con artists impersonating the authorities through emails, texts, calls and even appearing at people's front doors. Paul Connolly investigates the unscrupulous crooks using the lockdown to prey on others.

programme.title: Police Tapes
programme.sub-title: The Murder of Rhys Jones: Police Tapes
programme.desc: When 11-year-old Rhys Jones was shot dead on his way home from weekly football practice in 2007, his family was left shattered and police were left with a case that seemed impenetrable. But when certain names were mentioned again and again, the police planted secret bugs in the homes of these gang members. Here, Susanna Reid gains unprecedented access to the subsequent recordings, where those responsible admit their part and the lengths they would go to cover up the crime. She also talks to Rhys's parents, Mel and Steve, about the impact of this appalling crime.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Kim Cattrall is the first guest as the chat show returns, with the actress revealing why she turned down Sex and the City 3 and talking about her relationship with the other cast members following rumoured feuds. She also opens up to Piers about her three marriages and discusses why she was forced to pull out of a West End play.
